meanings.definition: A liquid used for rinsing the mouth to freshen breath and kill bacteria.
meanings.sent1: After brushing his teeth, John used mouthwash to make his breath fresh.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a bottle of mouthwash in my bathroom cabinet.
meanings.sent3: The mouthwash felt like a cool breeze in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like mouthwash, cleansing the negativity from the room.
meanings.sent5: The minty mouthwash danced on my tongue, leaving a refreshing sensation.

meanings.definition: To rinse one's mouth with mouthwash.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, she would mouthwash before leaving for work.
meanings.sent2: He mouthwashes twice a day for good oral hygiene.
meanings.sent3: As a joke, he pretended to mouthwash with soda instead of actual mouthwash.
meanings.sent4: She mouthwashed away the taste of the spicy food she had for lunch.
meanings.sent5: The actor mouthwashed before going on stage to ensure fresh breath.
